Incident.Summary: MDOP, Destruction of Front Door to JCI Facility.

IncidentSuppNarrative.NarrativeText: CASE #: 23-MSP-028172 SUSPECT: Summerville, Aneeh Yvette (B/F DOB: 02/25/2009) WITNESS: Brown, Sheena Taynisha (MD-10272588451) VICTIM: Jessup Correctional Institution / State of Maryland *THIS INCIDENT WAS RECORDED ON MY BODY-WORN CAMERA SYSTEM* NARRATIVE: On August 9, 2023 at approximately 1701 hours, I, Trooper Keller #7360, was on duty operating marked MSP vehicle P-28. I responded to the Jessup Correctional Institution (JCI), located at 7805 House of Correction Road, Jessup MD, 20794 in Anne Arundel County for a past occurred malicious destruction of property. Upon my arrival, I made contact with Correctional Officer II E. Onanuga and Captain H. Diggs at the Visitor Registration building. Capt. Diggs stated that on August 6, 2023 at approximately 1854 hours two black females entered the front door of the Visitor Registration building attempting to visit inmate Purnell Summerville. I was provided with the names Zakiya Wise (B/F approx. 14 y/o) and Sheena Taynisha Brown (B/F DOB: 09/26/1985), as the subjects involved and that they are mother and daughter. It was later found that Wise was not the suspect and that the name was incorrectly provided. Capt. Diggs stated that the juvenile was able to successfully pass through the metal detector but Brown set the detector off three times and was not allowed to enter the facility. Due to JCI policy, Brown was unable to enter the facility as well as the juvenile who is required to be accompanied by an adult. Due to this the juvenile became irate and began yelling profanity. Capt. Diggs stated that the juvenile then abruptly walked back through the security area and out the front exit door. While leaving the juvenile slammed the door causing the glass within to shatter while staying intact. At this time Capt. Diggs was contacted by Ofc. II Onanuga who was also on duty and at the front security desk when the incident occurred. Capt. Diggs made contact with Brown who took responsibility for her daughter and was advised that JCI would contact them directly with a cost estimate for the door once provided by maintenance. Capt. Diggs provided me with a form from JCI requesting suspension of visitation privileges for Wise as well as a written statement completed by Ofc. II Onanuga on the day of the incident. Capt. Diggs stated that two cameras, one within the building and another mounted outside facing towards the front door, recorded the incident. At this time, he only had the recording from the inside camera. I watched the recording which has no audio. I observed a black female, who appeared to be a juvenile approximately 14-16 years old, abruptly approach the front desk and grab a bag appearing to be her property. She then walks towards the exit quickly and turns while throwing up her arms and appearing to yell before quickly walking towards the exit which is out of view of the camera. Capt. Diggs stated when able he would provide me with a copy of the recording as well as the recording from the camera facing the door from the outside. I was provided with an incident report completed by Ofc. II Onanuga detailing the incident. The report was consistent with the events I observed as well as the supporting statements made. I observed the front door of the entrance heavily cracked with the large shatter near the bottom of the door and large cracks up the side. Images of the door were taken and have been added in attachments. Capt. Diggs advised that he would provide me with an estimated value of the door once he was advised by maintenance, but it is believed to be below $1000.00. FURTHER INVESTIGATION: On August 10, 2023 at approximately 1808 hours I responded to Browns residence located at 1013 Stormont Circle, Halethorpe MD, 21227 in Baltimore County. I made contact with subject Aneeh Yvette Summerville (B/F DOB: 02/25/2009) who advised that Brown was not home at the time. Summerville then stated Is this about the broken thing? Im the reason why. I advised Summerville to contact Brown and she did via Facetime video call. Both Brown and Summerville advised that they do not know any individual named Zakiya Wise and confirmed that Summerville was the individual who damaged the door. After collecting the information of the parties involved, Brown stated that she would like to speak on the phone later to provide a statement once she was not driving. I contacted Brown at approximently 1932 hours for a statement. Brown stated that Summerville had made it through the metal detector and was waiting against the wall. Brown was unable to pass through the metal detector successfully and set it off three times before being advised that she would not be able to enter. Brown stated that Summerville went off and pushed the door hard while exiting the building. The push caused the door to slam against the door stop causing the glass to crack. Brown stated that Summerville suffers from mental health issues and is Bipolar but is not diagnosed. She added that since the incident JCI has contacted her multiple times suspending her and Summervilles access to the building and discussing reimbursement for the door. Charges are pending JCI maintenance cost estimation of the damaged door. Incident occurred in Anne Arundel County, Maryland. Suspect and witness interview occurred in Baltimore County, Maryland.

IncidentProperty.Description: METAL FRONT DOOR WITH GLASS PANE

IncidentSuppNarrative.NarrativeText: On August 30,2023 at 2000 hours I, Trooper Keller #7360, was contacted via email by Captain Diggs regarding a damage estimate for the broken door to the Jessup Correctional Institution. A full copy of the estimate has been attached and displays a total cost of $2754.00 to repair the door. On September 5, 2023 at approximately 2200 hours I responded to Summerville and Browns residence at 1013 Stormont Cir, Halethorpe MD, 21227. I made contact with both individuals at the residence. Brown was provided with a Juvenile Release Form MSP 53 listing Summervilles release to her for Malicious Destruction of Property Valued $1,000+ (CR 6-301). Summerville was released to the custody of her mother, Ms. Brown at 2212 hours. All associated documentation will be filed with Anne Arundel County Department of Juvenile Services. Incident occurred in Anne Arundel County, Maryland. Juvenile Release served in Baltimore County, Maryland.

IncidentProperty.Description: METAL FRONT DOOR WITH GLASS PANE
